info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 4:06PM PDT until April 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM PDT SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches with 2 to 3 feet at higher elevations, including Diamond and Crater Lakes. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 2000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 PM PDT Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates in parts of the Cascades have a 90 to 100% probability to see 1" per hour snowfall rates Saturday from 12 AM to 11 AM. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
